p: At presentation, 83.0% of DENV patients were clinically diagnosed with a viral infection, while only 50% of patients in the CHIKV group were diagnosed with a viral infection ( Table 3). 10.2% of CHIKV patients were diagnosed with a bacterial infection and 12% as having a non-infectious aetiology by physicians ( Table 3). Malaria was suspected in 10% of DENV infected patients and 6% of CHIKV patients ( Table 3).
